text: Ro: Hey guys, welcome to another Nerdy Nummies! Today I have a special guest,

Ro: Trisha! Megumixbear! Trisha: Hi bear cubs,
thanks for having me!

Ro: Yeah, she’s on team booms. Team boobs!
Pew!

Ro: Today, we are gonna be making Pi Pies,
for many reasons, I love math!

Ro: A lot of people don’t know that in high
school, I can’t spell worth

Ro: a lick, but I was in AP Calculus! Trisha:
Wow, baller.
Ro: That’s right! That’s right Oh snap!

Ro: So, OK, it’s not official Pi Day, which
is March 14th, because get it,

Ro: 3… Trisha: 1… Ro: 14. Trisha: 4…
Ro: A-ha-ha-ha-ha! 3.14!

Ro: But we wanted to do this, because we plan
ahead right?

Trisha: Yeah, and I never made a pie. Ro:
Yeah, we never did a pie, so we

Ro: wanted to do something new, and you can
use this on March 14th for when
Ro: it comes up next year, for Pi Day!

Trisha: And word on the street is you’re
like, grandmaster baker level right?

Ro: Yeah. Trisha: OK, she’s gonna help me
out. Ro: Yeah.

Ro: So we’re gonna be making 2 different
kind of pies today, the first is a

Ro: berry pie, and the second is an apple
pie, and we’re gonna start off by

Ro: doing the fillings first. So we’re gonna
start off making the
Ro: berry filling first!

Trisha: You’ll need 4 cups of blackberries
or raspberries of your choice,

Trisha: 1 to 1-1/2 cups of sugar. Thanks sugar
mama for helping me out!

Ro: Mmmhmm. Trisha: 1/3 cup of flour, as well
as a teaspoon of cinnamon.

Trisha: And 1-1/2 tablespoon of butter. Ro:
Yeah! Tillamook! My favorite!

Ro: So take a big mixing bowl, and we’re
gonna do 1/2 raspberry,

Ro: 1/2 blackberry. 2 cups of raspberry, 2
cups of blackberry.

Trisha: Extra fiber, helps you when you’re
pushing.

Trisha: 1…. Ro: You’re gonna need 1-1/2
cups of sugar. Here’s a cup.
Ro: 1/3 cup of flour.
Trisha: A teaspoon of cinnamon.
Ro: Now we gotta put in the butter. Boop!

Ro: Just make sure that it’s soft, so you
can microwave it if you want.

Ro: So it’s gushy, and then we’re
gonna mix it around!

Ro: Now we are gonna make the apple filling.
What you will need, will be:

Ro: Cinnamon, ground nutmeg, lemon, lemon
juice! butter, brown sugar,

Ro: apples, I’m using granny smith apples,
and number cutouts.

Ro: So first what you’re gonna do, is in
the apple pie, we’re gonna decorate

Ro: tthe top, but the actual apples in the
apple pie are gonna be numbers,

Ro: and we’re gonna cut them out. So this
is gonna take a little while, so just

Ro: be patient if you’re doing this. First
you’re gonna peel it,

Ro: peel your apple, and I got about 8 apples,
so, that’s a good, if you need

Ro: more, you might want to get a few extra,
just in case.

Ro: Because when you cut the numbers out you
don’t use the full apple, so you
Ro: just want to make sure that you have enough.

Ro: Once you peel your apple, then you’re gonna
cut it into apple slices, and then

Ro: We’re gonna cut out the numbers, into
those slices.

Ro: Um, now we’re gonna make, we’re gonna
mix all the other ingredients

Ro: to make the apple pie filling! So first
we’re gonna add 4 tablespoons

Ro: of melted butter, this is so gushy, because
it just came out of the
Ro: microwave. So hopefully we can cut this!

Ro: Cut it right on 4 tablespoon. Trisha:
Uh oh! It’s not cutting!
Ro: Uh-oh! Oh, oh! Trisha: Oh got it!
Trisha: Bleh, bleh-bleh-bleh-bleh! Ro: Pfft!
Ro: Add it to the bowl. Make mature noises.
Trisha: Add 2 tablespoons of lemon juice.

Ro: Now we’re gonna do 1/2 a cup of brown
sugar. Are you ready?

Ro: 3 tablespoons of cinnamon, and now 1/4
teaspoon of nutmeg, and this

Ro: is is ground nutmeg, you don’t want
to put in a full nutmeg!

Ro: You want to make sure that it’s freshly
ground.

Ro: We got all of this ingredients all mushed
up together. And now we’re gonna slowly

Ro: add the apples. And we’re just gonna
be really gentle, because we

Ro: want to keep all of our shapes, we want
to keep all of our cute

Ro: little shapes intact. Trisha: So we want
to be nice, nice.

Ro: Yeah just be really slow and nice. Trisha:
Not like that!

Ro: No! Trisha: I’m just kidding! She almost killed
me!

Trisha: And next we’re gonna start with
the pie crust, and all we need to

Trisha: do is add water! Because these are
cheating pie crust!

Ro: These are cheating! All you have to do
is pour ‘em in. Trisha: Bleh!

Trisha: Oh! Ro: And add water. Trisha: The
idea is to, you cut this, and

Trisha: you want the inside of this to go in
the bowl.

Ro: And then the ratio is, for every box you
add 1/3 cup of water, so,
Ro: we have 4 boxes, so it’s 1-1/3 cup.

Trisha: OK. Ro: And you mix it like that.
Just massage it.
Ro: We can do is just take a ball,
Ro: and just squishy, squishy, squishy, squishy.

Ro: We got 2 bi’s, for 2 pie bottoms, roll
them in a ball, and I’ll start

Ro: them a little bit. and then Trisha want
to roll it out?
Ro: Roll it out a little.

Ro: Now we’re gonna put it in the pie. Trisha:
So you just lift it gently?
Ro: Yeah! And then just flop it in there.

Both: Ta-da! Ro: We got the bottom of our
pies done, now we’re gonna

Ro: fill them with both the berry filling
and the apple filling.
Ro: Meep-meep-meep-meep-meep!

Ro: And just put them in gently… Gently!
Trisha: Just get in there!

Ro: Oh that looks good! Trisha: Yum! Ro: That
smells so good!

Ro: Fresh berries! Trisha: I think I’m gonna
like this 1 better.

Ro: Now we’re gonna decorate the top of
the pie, the berry pie.

Ro: And we’re gonna cut out all the numbers
of Pi that will fit on here.

Ro: We’re gonna start with 3, and just remember
Pi is a really long number,

Ro: so just go as far as you can, as many
that will fit on the pie!

Ro: So we got the dough. Trisha: Be gentle.
Ro: Yeah, be gentle!

Ro: Ta-da! Berry pie is ready to pop in the
oven, we’re gonna finish the

Ro: apple pie, and then we’ll put them in
together!

Ro: This pie top, we’re gonna cover the
whole apple pie, and then we're gonna make the

Ro: Pi symbol, and all the way around cut
the little letters.

Ro: This is either gonna be super cool, or
super horrible.
Trisha: We got it, we got it, we got it!
Ro: We’re gonna attempt to pick this up…

Ro: Now we’re making the little Pi sign
on the top, and then these
Ro: puppies are ready to pop in the oven!

Ro: You’re gonna preheat your oven to 425
and then you’re gonna bake

Ro: both of them for 15 minutes, and then,
once it’s 15 minutes, you’re gonna

Ro: set your oven, you're gonna cool it down to about
350 and then bake for 30 minutes.
Trisha: Put it in.

Ro: Now go cool off, because it’s hot! Trisha:
Yeah!

Ro: Our Pi Pies are all done! Thanks you guys
for watching!

Ro: And, I’ll put Trisha’s link below
so you can go check her stuff out.

Ro: She does a lot of live streaming, almost
everyday on Twitch, but

Ro: she just started her YouTube channel not
too long ago.

Trisha: Yeah. Ro: So yeah, that’s getting
going!

Ro: OK, yeah… Trisha: I didn’t know what
to do, I was like, peace, thumb?
Trisha: Peace thumb! Ro: Yeah, yeah…

Ro: If you have any other suggestions for
any other Nerdy Nummies, please

Ro: leave me a comment below and I will do
